item.title: The Impossibility of Utilitarianism
item.description: (This is a paper I wrote for a philosophy course at University) Introduction “It is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong."1 It almost sounds like an a priori truth, but it is far from it. It’s the mantra of utilitarianism, the idea that the total amount of happiness2 created by an action determines whether it is good or bad. In this paper, I will argue that it is incorrect for a plethora of reasons.
